removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression and the inner parentheses around the operand are redundant; casting syntax requires parentheses around the type only, so (uint8_t*)&packedGridDimA is equivalent and clearer.
Same as above: the extra parentheses around the cast operand are unnecessary; (uint8_t*)&gridDimA is equivalent and more readable.
Outer parentheses and operand parentheses around the cast are redundant; use (uint8_t*)&packedBlockDimA for the same effect with better readability.
Remove redundant parentheses around the cast operand; (uint8_t*)&blockDimA is equivalent.
Redundant parentheses around the cast and its operand; (uint8_t*)&packedGridDimB is clearer and equivalent.
Remove unnecessary parentheses around the cast operand; the cast (uint8_t*)&gridDimB suffices.
Outer/operand parentheses around the cast are redundant; using (uint8_t*)&packedBlockDimB is equivalent and neater.
As above, parentheses around the cast operand are unnecessary and can be removed without changing meaning.
The outer parentheses around the cast expression in the function argument are unnecessary; (double*)y is the idiomatic form.
The outer parentheses enclosing the cast chain are redundant; removing them yields the same expression while improving readability.
Outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary; the cast expression is unchanged if the outer parens are removed.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses around the nested casts; (uint8_t*)((double*)y) is equivalent and clearer.
The outermost parentheses add no semantic value and can be removed to improve readability.
The parentheses around the whole product and the extra parentheses around the variable in the cast are unnecessary; (double)i * constant is clearer and equivalent.
The outer parentheses and several redundant operand-parentheses can be removed without changing precedence. Casting the subexpressions as shown keeps the intended types while improving clarity.
The inner parentheses around (num + factor) are unnecessary because addition/subtraction are left-associative; simplifying to (num + factor - 1) / factor preserves meaning.

Both the outer parentheses around the RHS and the inner parentheses around the multiplication are redundant: multiplication has higher precedence than addition, so removing them keeps the same evaluation and increases readability.
Same as above: the parentheses around the RHS and the inner product are unnecessary because operator precedence ensures the same result; removing them simplifies the expression.
Parentheses around a single variable used as a function argument are redundant; passing print_format_double directly is clearer.
Parentheses around the single argument are unnecessary in a function call; removing them improves readability.
Same as above: the extra parentheses add no value and can be removed.
